item.title: 英国采购经理人报告称通胀上升、增长放缓
item.description: 一项备受关注的行业调查显示，英国私营企业报告称，在大选前增长放缓，提价压力增大。【原文：Britain’s private sector companies reported slower growth and stronger pressures to increase prices in the lead up to the general election, a closely watched industry survey showed.】

item.title: 法国梅朗雄称左翼联盟将花费 2000 亿欧元
item.description: 法国左派联盟计划，如果在大选中获胜，将在未来五年为其优先事项投入2000亿欧元（约合2140亿美元）的公共开支，以扭转埃马纽埃尔-马克龙总统的劳动和养老金改革，促进经济增长。【原文：France’s leftist alliance plans public spending of €200 billion ($214 billion) for its priorities over the next five years if it wins the snap election as it seeks to reverse President Emmanuel Macron’s labor and pension reforms and boost growth.】

item.title: 美银美林称：技术资金流入创纪录，所有道路都通向英伟达
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的策略师表示，本周持续的人工智能热潮让英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：The ongoing artificial intelligence frenzy that briefly made Nvidia Corp. the world’s most valuable company this week also drove record inflows into tech funds, said Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 欧洲银行股涨势受到马克龙选举赌注的威胁
item.description: 在 2024 年的大部分时间里，欧洲银行股是该地区股市上涨的领头羊。随后，法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）给这一切带来了麻烦。【原文：For much of 2024, European bank stocks were the leaders of the region’s equities rally. Then French President Emmanuel Macron threw a spanner in the works.】

item.title: Helaba 计划与 20 亿欧元企业贷款挂钩的 SRT
item.description: 据知情人士透露，德国赫拉巴银行（Helaba）计划发布一项与约 20 亿欧元（21 亿美元）企业贷款池挂钩的重大风险转移计划。【原文：German bank Helaba plans to issue a significant risk transfer tied to a pool of about €2 billion ($2.1 billion) of corporate loans, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 法国商业活动因投票担忧意外减弱
item.description: 由于企业担心在未来几周的选举中政府发生剧变的可能性不断上升，法国私营部门的活动在 6 月份意外放缓。【原文：Private-sector activity in France unexpectedly slowed in June as businesses fret about the rising chance of a radical change in government at elections in the coming weeks.】

item.title: 印度考虑在预算中减税 60 亿美元以刺激消费
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）领导的政府正在考虑在即将公布的预算中采取价值超过 5000 亿卢比（约合 60 亿美元）的促进消费措施，其中包括七年来首次为低收入者减税。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government is considering consumption-boosting measures worth more than 500 billion rupees ($6 billion) in India’s upcoming budget, including tax cuts for lower income individuals for the first time in seven years, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 勒庞党在民调中支持率上升，马克龙支持率下降
item.description: 周五公布的一项民意调查显示，玛丽娜-勒庞领导的极右翼国民联盟党在法国立法选举前的支持率正在上升。另一项调查显示，埃马纽埃尔-马克龙总统的支持率正在下降。【原文：Support for the far-right National Rally party of Marine Le Pen is rising ahead of the French legislative elections, according to a poll published Friday. A separate survey showed declining approval for President Emmanuel Macron.】

item.title: 日本服务业活动近两年来首次萎缩
item.description: 由于企业面临投入成本上升的压力，日本制造业和服务业活动的主要指标在 6 月份有所减弱，其中服务业指标在近两年中首次出现萎缩。【原文：Key measures of Japan’s manufacturing and service activity weakened in June, with the services gauge registering a contraction for the first time in almost two years as companies faced strains from higher input costs.】

item.title: 中国宝武完成收购西芒杜项目股权
item.description: 中国宝武钢铁集团（China Baowu Steel Group）完成了对几内亚西芒杜项目（Simandou project）股份的收购，这家中国最大的钢铁制造商希望扩大其在世界最大的未开发铁矿中的利益。【原文：China Baowu Steel Group has completed its purchase of a stake in the Simandou project in Guinea, as China’s top steelmaker looks to expand its interest in the world’s largest untapped iron ore mine.】

item.title: 勒庞的崛起让法国债务市场面临多年的痛苦
item.description: 债券投资者将在数年内对法国政府借贷征收更高的利率，这一制度变革可能会对欧洲第二大经济体产生深远影响。【原文：Bond investors are set to impose a higher interest rate on French government borrowing for years, in a regime change that could have far reaching consequences for Europe’s second largest economy.】

item.description: 由于经济和政治相对稳定，投资者信心回升，本季度新加坡已成为并购活动的热土。【原文：Singapore has turned into a hive of activity for mergers and acquisitions this quarter as investor confidence returns, helped by relative economic and political stability.】

item.title: 中国将要求维萨和万事达降低交易费
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士说，中国正在推动威士公司和万事达公司降低其在中国的银行卡交易费，作为方便外国游客支付的努力的一部分。【原文：China is pushing for Visa Inc. and Mastercard Inc. to lower their bank card transaction fees in the country, a person familiar with the matter said, as part of an effort to facilitate payments for foreign visitors.】

item.description: Currys Plc 首席执行官亚历克斯-鲍尔多克（Alex Baldock）表示，英国新政府应确保最低工资的提高不会使雇佣更多工人的成本过高。【原文：A new UK government should ensure that increases in the minimum wage don’t make hiring more workers prohibitively costly, according to Currys Plc Chief Executive Officer Alex Baldock.】

item.title: 波兰决策者希望 2025 年降息，不排除加息可能
item.description: 波兰政策制定者加布里埃拉-马斯洛夫斯卡（Gabriela Maslowska）表示，不排除欧盟成员国降息或加息的可能性，但她表示希望明年能降低借贷成本。【原文：Polish policymaker Gabriela Maslowska said that neither interest rate cuts nor hikes could be ruled out in the European Union member state, though she expressed the hope that lower borrowing costs would happen next year.】

item.title: 马克龙当选后，巴黎作为金融中心的崛起岌岌可危
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙在其任期内的大部分时间都在说服银行家和基金经理们在英国脱欧后涌入巴黎。他决定举行大选可能会让一些业内人士感到不安。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron spent much of his tenure persuading bankers and fund managers to flock to Paris after Brexit. His decision to call snap elections may give some in the industry pause.】

item.title: 化妆品连锁店莎莎计划拓展亚洲市场，以摆脱香港市场的低迷
item.description: 香港最大的化妆品连锁店莎莎国际控股有限公司正计划在中国大陆和东南亚进一步扩张，以帮助弥补其国内市场在科维德事件后的低迷复苏。【原文：Hong Kong’s biggest cosmetics chain, Sa Sa International Holdings Ltd., is planning to further expand in mainland China and Southeast Asia, to help make up for the sluggish post-Covid recovery of its home market.】

item.title: 尽管观察名单发出警告，日元仍牢牢受制于干预措施
item.description: 策略师们表示，尽管美国对日本的外汇做法发出了警告，但通过干预来支持日元的风险依然存在。【原文：The risk of intervention to support the yen remains alive and well despite a warning shot from the US about Japan’s foreign-exchange practices, strategists said.】

item.title: 建造商路王警告违约风险
item.description: 中国开发商路劲基础设施有限公司（Road King Infrastructure Ltd.）警告投资者，如果他们不接受该公司提出的以折扣价回购部分债券并给予该公司更多时间偿还剩余债务的建议，该公司可能会违约。【原文：Chinese developer Road King Infrastructure Ltd. is warning investors that it may default if they don’t accept its proposals to buy some bonds back at discounts and give the company more time to pay back the rest of the debt.】

item.title: 布拉德称最新美国 CPI 指数燃起 9 月降息希望
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行前行长詹姆斯-布拉德（James Bullard）表示，尽管最新的通胀数据燃起了9月份降息的希望，但他预计美国货币政策放松的步伐将十分缓慢。【原文：Former Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard said he expects the pace of US monetary policy easing to be slow, although the latest inflation print sparks hope for a September interest-rate cut.】
